content.description: Sit start low on small sidepull crimps. Left hand is at bottom of fang-like feature and right hand is at the same level to the right on another small crimp.Move up to bigger sidepull pockets, then throw up to slopers. Top out straight up on the right side, avoiding the jugs out leftRamp down and to the right is off!
content.location: Back (right corner) of the One-shot boulder.

content.description: Start on the low jug on the left arête, work your way up the arête and topout above.
content.location: The Fridge boulder, touching the SE corner of The Slab boulder

content.description: Stand Start V2 with left hand in a two-finger pocket and right hand on the arete. Or SDS (sit-down start) with buttocks on the ground, V3 with left hand on an undercling and right hand on the arete. For the SDS the beta I used (others possible) is to go up right hand to the pocket and match it. Fun climb, reachy near top.Anyone know of a different name for this one / FA? I can update.
content.location: The arete to the right of the One-Shot arete, same boulder.

content.description: Climb the tall slab. Careful not to fall at the top!
content.location: To the right of Ribeye.

content.description: Starts in the big undercling where Orange Crush starts and exits immediately to the right towards Bomb-oh-lay-oh. Finish right of Bomb-oh-lay-oh on the right face only using the starting jug of that problem.
Stand start and climb up, topping out directly above
content.location: Stand start between The Protuberance and Sky High

content.description: Stand start using the left hand undercling and right hand sloper dish, climb straight up, and top out at the tallest part of the wall directly above
content.location: On the Slab boulder between Son of the Sky and Death of a Salesman

content.description: Face climb. Climbs the center line on the one-shot boulder. Sit start with a left sidepull and right hand undercling. Go up with right hand to the good pocket shared with "two shots" (the right arete).  Tops out at the crack feature in the center.
content.location: The one-shot boulder. Climbs the center face to the right of one-shot and left of two shots.

content.description: Use the small features on the face in combination with the arete to make your way up to the generous rail. A comfortable top out and rock staircase to the right make this one very accessible.
content.location: About 100m up the trail behind Death of a Salesman. To the right of the distinctive swirl pattern on the face.

content.description: Fun power route with a nice flow. Starts matched on the jug rail bottom right. Left hand to next jug, then continue straight up. Crux is matching the sloper at top of lip, then out right to jugs. Top out.Be careful on the downclimb! Climb down to the left.If you have info on the name/FA let me know.
content.location: This is uphill a few boulders from the starting holds on Monkey Man on the Cube. Downhill from Blank Stare, the tall V1.

content.description: Start with hands in the low horizontal of the beautiful S-shaped crack and climb it up/right, reach the jug on the face, reach the crimp rail on top, then topout using the large, dirty L-hand sloper gaston. If the rock quality on the topout were as good as the beginning, this problem would be 3 stars. Make sure you have pads and spotters to help with the uneven landing.
content.location: On the Downhill Boulder that sits below the trail and between the Cube Boulder and the Slab Boulder. Walk to it from standing below Fire In The Sky.

content.description: Shares a start with Rawhide. The original line. Climb up and then use the large foot out left to get up and over the bulge. Top out straight up and to the left, with lots of good features for hands out to the left.Rawhide continues up to the right. The large foot on the left after the bulge is off.

A great compression climb with a subpar landing that can be improved with at least 4 pads. Alternatively large logs could be stacked at the bottom. Climb starts low, hanging upside down with a low left hand and heel hooks. Climb up to a left incut hold, and then a large move for the right hand up to a sloper. get higher feet and continue up, trending right for the topout.
content.location: Next to Rawhide, just to the right. Starts on the bottom of the overhanging compression problem.

content.description: Fun climb up the main roof of the cave. Start matched on the low jug rail, work up to the slot and then go up with the left hand to a crimp. Carry on over the bulge and trend right to top out at the apex.
content.location: Directly up the hill (north) from the main shotgun boulders and the start to Monkey Man. Then a little to the west (left) at the top of the hill.

content.description: SDS or hanging start on the low jug, climb through the left facing flake, then topout in the notch above onto the slab.
content.location: Slab boulder, around to the right from Fire In The Sky

content.description: Start on a right hand pinch and left side pull. Work your way up the face and to the left of the balancing rock at the top.
content.protection: 2 pads. One for the ground and the other for the tree.
content.location: To the left of Should be Arete.  On the right edge of the distinct swirl pattern.

content.description: Climb the left arete of the roof, with a low (stand/crouch) start all the way down in the cave. Climb straight up the left side of the arete, To the left of the main line "Rawhide"
content.location: Uphill from the main shotgun area. Past Ribeye and Rawhide to the left (west) at the end of the cave.

content.description: Start on Orange Crush, but once reaching the lip finish up and to the left, making use of the small pockets on the face and avoiding the large flake to the right
content.location: Cube boulder - the first one on the trail

content.description: Start on Orange Crush but finish on Monkey Man. SDS in the pockets in the middle of the overhang, get to the lip, then traverse right and top out just right of the arête.
content.protection: The Cube boulder - the first one on the trail

content.description: Sit start under the overhang on a good pocket in the honeycomb feature and throw for the lip or the obvious pocket before it. Once on the lip, go for the crimp rail and a heel hook to mantle.
Comfortable holds and good feet. Great for warming up or introducing new climbers to taller boulders.
content.location: The right arete across the downclimb from Should be Arete.

content.description: Start far left on the lip and work your way to the right corner with a series of heel hooks and well-placed hands (maybe some crossovers) on mostly slopers and crimps. Swing your legs around when you get to the corner and grab a crimp to top out on the face around the corner.
content.protection: crash pad, spotter to move the crash pad as you traverse

content.description: Start on Monkey Man but finish early on Orange Crush. SDS on the left end of the lip, traverse right, then finish up the middle of the face on the left facing flake.
content.location: The Cube boulder

content.description: SDS on the same start hold as Monkey Man, but climb immediately up and slightly left through a few sloper rails. Not a bad warm up - large holds that are easy on the fingers.
content.location: Cube Boulder

content.description: Start at the jug around head height. Then go straight up to the good slit. Exit to the right following the lighter streak on the rock.
content.location: About 30 feet to the left of Rapid Fire.

content.description: Climbs the arete on the right side of the fridge boulder.SDS with both hands on the chossy lieback hands and topout straight above.
content.location: Fridge boulder, just right of the Slab Boulder.

content.description: Decent little lip traverse. Starts on the very bottom point with the left hand on a undercling and right hand on the sloper dish. Traverse the right lip of the boulder using the crimps and features just above the lip. Use the footblock until it disappears halfway up the lip and finish the rest with some classic lip traverse footwork.
content.location: Just uphill and maybe 100 ft east of Sky High.

content.description: Climb the first half of Fire in the Sky but trend left on the face and top out on the top left corner of the boulder on Fire in the Hole.
content.location: Front face of the 2nd big boulder in the main area. Same boulder as the Protuberance and Sky High

content.description: An Oklahoma classic. Start with both hands matched on a low sloper, with feet out to the right. Move up and slightly left on crimps and pinches to the lip, then finish on the 20ft slab above.
content.location: West, downhill side, of The Cube boulder

content.description: Start on an obvious jug at waist height. Climb the arete using a couple crimps on the face, a good kneebar, and a few holds around the corner. Top out on the top left side of the face.
content.location: Left of Fire in the Sky on the corner

content.description: Match start under the boulder with a low undercling. Work your way up the boulder though a C shaped line (see photo). Short, stout and sure to break your heart!
content.protection: 2 pads - one for the ground and one for the boulder behind you
content.location: On the Downhill Boulder that sits below the trail and between the Cube Boulder and the Slab Boulder. Walk to it from standing below Fire In The Sky.The line is facing SW or towards the primary parking area.

content.description: Stand a tart on the undercling just right of S-wave and climb up and slightly left on crimps.
content.location: On the Downhill Boulder that sits below the trail and between the Cube Boulder and the Slab Boulder. Walk to it from standing below Fire In The Sky

content.description: VB/V0 Arete. An easy warmup.
content.location: On the boulder to the right of the One-shot boulder, up the hill from the main area.

content.description: This is the obvious and inviting left exit of Fifth Year.
content.location: On the Downhill Boulder that sits below the trail and between the Cube Boulder and the Slab Boulder. Walk to it from standing below Fire In The Sky. This climb faces SW

content.description: Powerful moves through small amazing holds, then a cryptic upper section that is fun to figure out. A bit of a heady topout similar to Skyhigh.From the large sloper (shared with Sky High), you can either top out up/left like sky high or finish more directly up (sketchier due to the fridge boulder).
content.protection: A few pads and spotters is an easy way to reduce the risk of injury.
content.location: On the east face of the Slab boulder. Just right of Skyhigh.

content.description: This traverse links into the second half of Sky High. Pull onto the start holds of The Protuberance, traverse right (and somewhat uphill) through Son of the Sky to a small right facing rail. From here, crux moves to reach Sky High’s wide pinch with the right hand will lead to a familiar finish through the red ear, sloper, and top out.
content.location: Same low jug start as The Protuberance on the Slab Boulder

content.description: Very Fun arete boulder problem! Id say v3-   Start at a huge jug that you match on near the bottom. One foot on the obvious pocket on the incline of boulder. Heelhook your way to the tip of arete and finish strong on a couple of nice wide crimps straight up from the tip of the arete.
content.protection: very easy to slip off a crimp or miss a foot when cranking up, use one to two pads and a spotter is nice. Easy top out to walk around and down.
content.location: On the same wall as monkey boy and orange overhand throw.

content.description: Start a few feet right of The Edge, just below the large undercling, then topout on the blunt arête above.
content.location: On the Downhill Boulder that sits below the trail and between the Cube Boulder and the Slab Boulder. Walk to it from standing below Fire In The Sky

content.description: Clamber up the face until halfway you face a blank piece of wall. Use the arete or high feet to throw for the top.
content.location: To the left of Lock and Load. You'll see a large corner with a small cave at its base.

content.description: Start on sidepulls and get up to the matched hold. Dyno or throw to the top!
content.location: On the boulder to the right of the One-shot boulder.

content.description: Start with hands matched on the upper lip of the giant pocket. Make your way to the lip and mantle straight up (don't go up left). It is possible to do a standard sit start, but toe hooking the lip with hands on the start hold is easier.
content.location: Between the starting holds for Monkey Man and Orange Crush.

content.description: Follows a line of finger pockets up and left from a sit/smear start. First move is the crux, a right hand slap onto the block to find feet. Pocket features are amazing but brittle, so use care.
content.protection: Pads/spotter, beware the death block behind you
content.location: The tall slab boulder in between the cube (Monkey Man) boulder and the Fire in the Sky boulder. Uphill from both 10ft. There are several problems on the back side of the slab.

content.description: The first dense collection of boulders, home to classics like Monkey Man, Fire In The Sky, and Sky High.
